summary:
I’m passionate about hospitality, creating better experiences for customers and employees alike through innovations that take our industry further. 

My work experience in fast-paced hotel operations spreads across a variety of luxury hotels in Germany, France, Switzerland and Russia. 

After graduating from the École hôtelière de Lausanne in 2013, I joined a hospitality training tech-driven start up in the Netherlands where I first focused on product research & development in the early stages and thereafter lead the commercial team to growing our market presence.

The start-up world has been a real eye-opener and has allowed me to dive deeper into skills such as project management, growing a team, coaching, leadership, inspiring motivation, critical thinking, sales, negotiation and business development. 

What I enjoy most is creating a connection with people from all around the world, and it fuels me to work with a dynamic, diverse & energetic team to bring new ideas to fruition!

Leadership, growth & revenue.'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Thea', 'last_name': 'Domecq', 'name': None, 'headline': '.'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sébastien', 'last_name': 'Gottraux', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Vice President at Global Hospitality Investment Group'}]}, {'title': 'Sustainability in the Hospitality Industry', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Aim: Provide hoteliers with a holistic approach to sustainability through a guideline and market their efforts internally and externally

This project was created as part of the final year of the Bachelor Program at l’Ecole hôtelière de Lausanne (here forth referred to as EHL) in partnership with the Institute of Innovation and Entrepreneuship of the university. EHL provides a management level education and is recognized as a top business school while conveying its unique philosophy: hospitality management as both a science and an art.

The Student Business Project (here forth referred to as the SBP) provides a concrete conclusion to the studies at EHL. Each SBP consists of a group of 5 students who help to develop a high-quality plan for the chosen company. The team has nine weeks to complete a given mandate. For this project, the students worked with Diversey. Diversey, now part of Sealed Air, is a world leader in cleaning and hygiene solutions for hospitality, food service, food and beverage, health care, retail, and building service contracting. The company has supported the hospitality sector for decades and works with some of the largest and best-known international groups as well as numerous independent hotels to help them introduce continuous improvement into their cleaning processes.

•	Lead generation, qualification and sales conversion
•	Creation of a business network and nurturing positive long-term relationships with key accounts & partners
•	Branding, positioning and communication strategies
•	Product strategy in line with market needs
•	Training and coaching for all commercial team members

About Novility:
Novility creates the most innovative hospitality tech and strives to be the industry’s premier digital training supplier. Our global team designs and develops interactive learning tools that provide state-of the-art training unparalleled in the industry. By integrating ergonomics best practices, we minimize risk and promote overall employee well-being. The result: improvement in operational productivity and manpower skill - key drivers in increasing profitability for hotels and creating a customer experience that continually exceeds expectations. At Novility, we believe wholeheartedly in learning by doing – and it’s through employee analytics that we turn organizational insights into action.
